claim.claim-text: 1. An optical image capturing system, in order along an optical axis from an object side to an image side, comprising:a first lens having positive refractive power;a second lens having positive refractive power;a third lens having refractive power;a fourth lens having refractive power;a fifth lens having refractive power; andan image plane;wherein the optical image capturing system has a total of the five lenses with refractive power; at least one lens among the third to the fifth lenses has positive refractive power; each lens among the first lens to the fifth lens has an object-side surface, which faces the object side, and an image-side surface, which faces the image side; the object-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface, and the image-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface;wherein the optical image capturing system satisfies:2.0≤f/HEP≤2.4;45 deg<HAF≤55 deg; and0.5≤SETP/STP<1;wherein f is a focal length of the optical image capturing system; HEP is an entrance pupil diameter of the optical image capturing system; HAF is a half of a maximum view angle of the optical image capturing system; ETP1, ETP2, ETP3, ETP4, and ETP5 are respectively a thickness of the first lens, the second lens, the third lens, the fourth lens, and the fifth lens at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis; SETP is a sum of the aforementioned ETP1 to ETPS; TP1, TP2, TP3, TP4, and TP5 are respectively a thickness of the first lens, the second lens, the third lens, the fourth lens, and the fifth lens on the optical axis; STP is a sum of the aforementioned TP1 to TP5.

2. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the object-side surface of the second lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface, and the image-side surface of the second lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface; the object-side surface of the fourth lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface, and the image-side surface of the fourth lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface.

3. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:TP4>TP2>TP5>TP1>TP3;wherein TP1 is a thickness of the first lens on the optical axis; TP2 is a thickness of the second lens on the optical axis; TP3 is a thickness of the third lens on the optical axis; TP4 is a thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis; TP5 is a thickness of the fifth lens on the optical axis.

4. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:2.1≤TP4/TP5≤3.1;wherein TP4 is a thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis; TP5 is a thickness of the fifth lens on the optical axis.

5. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:1.2<TP4/TP2<1.9;wherein TP2 is a thickness of the second lens on the optical axis; TP4 is a thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis.

6. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:9≤|f1/f4|≤15;wherein f1 is a focal length of the first lens; f4 is a focal length of the fourth lens.

7. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:0.3≤SETP/EIN<1; and|TDT|≤2%;wherein EIN is a distance in parallel with the optical axis between the coordinate point at the height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis on the object-side surface of the first lens and a coordinate point at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis on the image-side surface of the fifth lens; TDT is TV distortion.

8. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:MTFE0≥0.01;MTFE3≥0.01; andMTFE7≥0.01;wherein HOI is a maximum height for image formation perpendicular to the optical axis on the image plane; MTFE0, MTFE3, and MTFE7 are respectively a value of modulation transfer function in a spatial frequency of 55 cycles/mm at the optical axis, 0.3 HOI, and 0.7 HOI on the image plane for infrared light.

9. The optical image capturing system of claim 1, further comprising an aperture, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:0.79≤InS/HOS≤0.83;wherein InS is a distance between the aperture and the image plane on the optical axis; HOS is a distance between the object-side surface of the first lens and the image plane on the optical axis.

10. An optical image capturing system, in order along an optical axis from an object side to an image side, comprising:a first lens having positive refractive power;a second lens having positive refractive power;a third lens having refractive power;a fourth lens having refractive power;a fifth lens having refractive power; andan image plane;wherein the optical image capturing system has a total of the five lenses with refractive power; at least one lens among the third lens to the fifth lens has positive refractive power; each lens among the first lens to the fifth lens has an object-side surface, which faces the object side, and an image-side surface, which faces the image side; the object-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface, and the image-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface; the object-side surface of the fourth lens has at least one inflection point, and the image-side surface of the fourth lens has at least one inflection point;wherein the optical image capturing system satisfies:2.0≤f/HEP≤2.4;45 deg<HAF≤55 deg; and0.2≤EIN/ETL<1;wherein f is a focal length of the optical image capturing system; HEP is an entrance pupil diameter of the optical image capturing system; HAF is a half of a maximum view angle of the optical image capturing system; ETL is a distance in parallel with the optical axis between a coordinate point at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis on the object-side surface of the first lens and the image plane; EIN is a distance in parallel with the optical axis between the coordinate point at the height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis on the object-side surface of the first lens and a coordinate point at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis on the image-side surface of the fifth lens.

11. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:IN12>IN34>IN23>IN45;wherein IN12 is a distance on the optical axis between the first lens and the second lens; IN23 is a distance on the optical axis between the second lens and the third lens; IN34 is a distance on the optical axis between the third lens and the fourth lens; IN45 is a distance on the optical axis between the fourth lens and the fifth lens.

12. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:17≤IN12/IN45≤23;wherein IN12 is a distance on the optical axis between the first lens and the second lens; IN45 is a distance on the optical axis between the fourth lens and the fifth lens.

13. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:Nd1>Nd5>Nd2;wherein Nd1 is a refractive index of the first lens; Nd2 is a refractive index of the second lens; Nd5 is a refractive index of the fifth lens.

14. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:1.84≤HOS/HOI≤1.89;wherein HOS is a distance between the object-side surface of the first lens and the image plane on the optical axis; HOI is a maximum height for image formation perpendicular to the optical axis on the image plane.

15. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the object-side surface of the third lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface, and the image-side surface of the third lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface; the object-side surface of the fourth lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface, and the image-side surface of the fourth lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface.

16. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:MTFQ0>0.01;MTFQ3>0.01; andMTFQ7>0.01;wherein HOI is a maximum height for image formation perpendicular to the optical axis on the image plane for infrared light; MTFQ0, MTFQ3, and MTFQ7 are respectively values of modulation transfer function in a spatial frequency of 110 cycles/mm at the optical axis, 0.3 HOI, and 0.7 HOI on the image plane for infrared light.

17. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:0<ED45/IN45≤50;wherein ED45 is a horizontal distance between the fourth lens and the fifth lens at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis; IN45 is a distance on the optical axis between the fourth lens and the fifth lens.

18. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:0<ED12/IN12≤50;wherein ED12 is a horizontal distance between the first lens and the second lens at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis; IN12 is a distance on the optical axis between the first lens and the second lens.

19. The optical image capturing system of claim 10, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:0.1≤(TP5+IN45)/TP4≤50;wherein TP4 is a central thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis, TP5 is a central thickness of the fifth lens on the optical axis, and IN45 is a distance on the optical axis between the fourth lens and the fifth lens.

20. An optical image capturing system, in order along an optical axis from an object side to an image side, comprising:a first lens having positive refractive power;a second lens having positive refractive power;a third lens having negative refractive power;a fourth lens having refractive power;a fifth lens having refractive power; andan image plane;wherein the optical image capturing system has a total of the five lenses having refractive power; at least one lens among the fourth lens to the fifth lens has positive refractive power; each lens among the first lens to the fifth lens has an object-side surface, which faces the object side, and an image-side surface, which faces the image side; the object-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a concave surface, and the image-side surface of the first lens passed through by the optical axis is a convex surface; the object-side surface of the fourth lens has at least one inflection point, and the image-side surface of the fourth lens has at least one inflection point;wherein the optical image capturing system satisfies:2.0≤f/HEP≤2.4;45 deg≤HAF≤55 deg; and0.5≤SETP/STP<1;wherein f is a focal length of the optical image capturing system; HEP is an entrance pupil diameter of the optical image capturing system; HAF is a half of a maximum view angle of the optical image capturing system; ETP1, ETP2, ETP3, ETP4, and ETP5 are respectively a thickness of the first lens, the second lens, the third lens, the fourth lens, and the fifth lens at a height of half of the entrance pupil diameter away from the optical axis; SETP is a sum of the aforementioned ETP1 to ETPS; TP1, TP2, TP3, TP4, and TP5 are respectively a thickness of the first lens, the second lens, the third lens, the fourth lens, and the fifth lens on the optical axis; STP is a sum of the aforementioned TP1 to TP5.

21. The optical image capturing system of claim 20, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:2.1≤TP4/TP5≤3.1;wherein TP4 is a thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis; TP5 is a thickness of the fifth lens on the optical axis.

22. The optical image capturing system of claim 20, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:1.2≤TP4/TP2≤1.9;wherein TP2 is a thickness of the second lens on the optical axis; TP4 is a thickness of the fourth lens on the optical axis.

23. The optical image capturing system of claim 20, wherein the optical image capturing system further satisfies:9≤|f1/f4|≤15;wherein f1 is a focal length of the first lens; f4 is a focal length of the fourth lens.

24. 25.
